The average velocity of an object is determined by the total distance traveled divided by the time taken. In the context of velocity-time graphs, the average velocity can be calculated by finding the area under the velocity-time curve.

conclusion: The area under Car B's graph from t = 0 to t = t1 represents the distance traveled by Car B.
